Evidence-Informed Behaviour Support Services

Supporting participants with Functional Behaviour Assessments, Positive Behaviour Support Plans, and implementation coaching. Clinical practice informed by experience as a former NDIA Senior Complex Support Needs Planner.

Specialist Behaviour Support Services

Delivered in alignment with the NDIS Quality and Safeguards Commission Capability Framework.

üìä

Functional Behaviour Assessment (FBA)

A comprehensive assessment to understand the function of behaviours of concern using evidence-informed frameworks such as SEAT (Sensory, Escape, Attention, Tangible).

  • Identification of environmental and contextual triggers
  • Baseline data collection and analysis
  • Risk identification and safety planning
üìù

Positive Behaviour Support (PBS) Plans

Development of high-quality, compliant PBS plans focused on proactive strategies, skill-building, and the reduction of regulated restrictive practices.

  • Proactive and reactive strategy development
  • Least-restrictive practice focus and phase-out planning
  • Direct lodging via the NDIS Commission Portal
ü§ù

Implementation & Coaching

Practical, hands-on support to ensure strategies are implemented consistently and safely across all environments.

  • Competency-based coaching for carers and support workers
  • Ongoing reviews and data-driven monitoring
  • Collaboration with therapists and multidisciplinary teams

The Behaviour Support Process

A structured, transparent approach informed by clinical practice and deep understanding of NDIS systems.

01

Intake & Ethical Fit

Initial consultation to understand goals, assess suitability, and ensure the participant‚Äôs rights and preferences guide the process.

02

Evidence Gathering

Data collection through observation, interviews, and review of existing reports to build a clear understanding of behaviour and context.

03

Plan Development

Development of a comprehensive PBS plan aligned with NDIS legislation, practice guidance, and the participant‚Äôs goals.

04

Active Implementation

Coaching, training, and ongoing monitoring to ensure strategies are effective, safe, and consistently applied.

Provider & Coordinator FAQs

What is your current capacity?

I maintain immediate capacity for assessments and PBS plans Australia-wide via Telehealth, and locally in Melbourne West.

How do you handle travel?

Travel is charged at the standard NDIS rate. I service Tarneit, Werribee, Melton, and surrounding areas.

Are you a Suitable Practitioner?

Yes ‚Äî I am an NDIS Suitable Behaviour Support Practitioner (ID: P1636047), regulated by the NDIS Commission.

Do you support restrictive practice reporting?

Yes. I specialise in reducing and eliminating regulated restrictive practices through proactive strategies, environmental adjustments, and skill-building.

Ready to Begin?

As an independent practitioner, I offer personalised support without long waitlists.
